top_categories.workout_context: Southern Cross Gravel’s north georgia mountain gravel, forest roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Southern Cross Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Southern Cross Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 100 miles, Southern Cross Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Southern Cross Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Southern Cross Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Southern Cross Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Southern Cross Gravel’s punchy mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Southern Cross Gravel’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Southern Cross Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on punchy mountain gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Southern Cross Gravel’s punchy mountain gravel delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Southern Cross Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Southern Cross Gravel’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Southern Cross Gravel demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride punchy mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: north georgia mountain gravel, forest roads, technical doubletrack. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 100 miles of punchy mountain gravel in Dahlonega, Georgia.
